intro: Gamochaeta stachidifolia, commonly known as the hairy false fleabane, is a flowering plant in the sunflower family (Asteraceae). It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and its small, yellow flowers are arranged in clustered heads. It produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Gamochaeta stachidifolia is often found in open areas such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
